chart.title: CO₂ reductions needed to keep global temperature rise below 1.5°C
chart.subtitle: Annual emissions of carbon dioxide under various mitigation scenarios to keep global average temperature rise below 1.5°C. Scenarios are based on the CO₂ reductions necessary if mitigation had started – with global emissions peaking and quickly reducing – in the given year.
chart.note: Carbon budgets are based on a >66% chance of staying below 1.5°C from the IPCC's SR15 Report.
